snippet: A federal appeals court ruled that colleges cannot count competitive cheerleading as a sport when trying to comply with gender-equity requirements, upholding an earlier decision.
abstract: Federal appeals court rules that colleges cannot count competitive cheerleading as a sport when trying to comply with gender-equity requirements, upholding an earlier decision; other college sports news noted.

byline.original: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS and ZACH SCHONBRUN

lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court ruled that colleges cannot count competitive cheerleading as a sport when trying to comply with gender-equity requirements, upholding an earlier decision.

headline.seo: Cheerleading Loses a Title IX Ruling; Not a Sport, Court Says
headline.main: Cheerleading Loses a Title IX Ruling
headline.print_headline: Cheerleading Loses a Title IX Ruling
